records.location_details: The incident occurred at the Serbian-Bulgarian border. Migrants crossed from Bulgaria to Serbia, were apprehended near the border by Serbian police, subjected to alleged ill-treatment, and forced to cross a river back into Bulgaria. The specific location of apprehension is redacted.
records.where_clear: Serbian-Bulgarian border, involving a river crossing
records.uncertainty_note: Specific location details are redacted in the document.

possible_violations.violation_name: Prohibition of inhuman or degrading treatment
possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 3 of the European Convention on Human Rights
Article 4 of Protocol No 4 to the European Convention on Human Rights

records.context_note: A group of seven migrants crossed from Bulgaria to Serbia. They were apprehended by Serbian police, allegedly subjected to ill-treatment (forced removal of clothes, physical violence including kicking and beating with stick/baton, punching) and collective expulsion back into Bulgaria by forcing them to cross a river. Photographic evidence of injuries (bruises and inflamed sores on feet) was provided by one migrant. Serbian authorities deny the allegations.
records.evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office considers likely that a group of seven migrants was apprehended by the Serbian police officers in Serbia, transferred by police car to the riverbank, and subsequently forced to cross the border into Bulgaria. The Office was unable to independently corroborate the alleged ill-treatment but considers it possible, that the group was subjected to ill-treatment before their collective expulsion.
